result.execSummary:
The defendant Selena R Martin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay all costs and surcharges by 11-02-2015. If unpaid a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Selena R Martin in court with attorney Glenn Edward Gaskill.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Sentencing proceeded. Statements by parties.  
Court sentences defendant to serve 3 days  in the House of Correction with credit for 3 days, a TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.
Defendant to pay all costs and surcharges by 11-02-2015.  If unpaid a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.
Appeal rights given.  

Filed: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, Pretrial Incarceration Credit

Defendant Selena R Martin in court with attorney Glenn Edward Gaskill.  Kathryn M West appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 46. jks  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 05-04-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Selena R Martin in court with attorney Brian Ward for attorney Glenn Edward Gaskill.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense asks for another status date because he is unsure what direction attorney Gaskill wants to take this case.   Court will allow a few days.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 46.jks
  Status conference scheduled for 03-19-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Selena R Martin in court.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is not eligible for representation by the public defender's office.  Defendant requests time to retain counsel.  Court ordered case adjourned for status of counsel in Branch 46. jks
  Status conference scheduled for 03-16-2015 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered Defendant not to be in possession of any illegal drugs without a valid prescription.

Defendant Selena R Martin in court.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Reserve, Branch 46. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel.   Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 46.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 11, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 2-2-2015 at 1:30pm
